page.title: 01Viewpark and Uddingston area
page.content: Viewpark, a former mining village ringed round with rich wood- land, stands 'up-the-hill' of the east bank of the Clyde Valley. 'Doon- the-hill' is the more well-to-do Uddingston by the Clyde itself. Their combined population and that of other areas adjoining is around 15,000. Extensive coal-mining has entirely given way to a varied cross-section of industries which do not take up all of the labour force. Many workers commute to other towns especially Glasgow. The road network is adequate and partly being modernised at present. It includes the M74 and busy interch- ange. The main rail-lines from Glas- gow to both Edinburgh and London pass through Uddingston.
